member.name: T:Storyteller.Properties.JavascriptResources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.JavascriptResources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.JavascriptResources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.JavascriptResources.Test_js
T:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.ActionNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Action Node is used to illustrate actions in audio form and text such as , "Glass breakes and a shard cuts the hair" "earthquake" "Jumps to the left" "jumps to the right" ...etc.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.BETATasks
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to BETA task 1 ) Try to create a max 2 minute long story, storyboard with or without voice and audio
BETA task 2) Replicate 1 minute of the most memorable moment of any movie or animation that you remember. .

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.CharacterNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Character Node is the first nod ethat you usually create , is defines your character. You can add an picture of your character to the character node by double clicking the picture area in the character node. You can determine if you want your character to be a Main, supporting or Background character and also add a backstory to the character. There is a section under the character image where you set a color the represent the character. this color will be used to chain along all the nodes you connect [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.EnvironmentNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Scene Nodes allow you to display where an entire et of Dialogues take place . Dialogues take place wherever your scene node begins and ends where another scene node is connected. .

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.EventNode
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Dialogue nodes are the most powerful nodes, they allows for you to do immediate voiceovers for your character instead of writing out an Dialogue. Simply double click the microphone icon in the Dialogue node to begin recording. You have the option of selection for any microphone connected to your computer by right clicking anywhere in the canvas and opening "Settings and Overview", under the audio folder tab, click on any microphone listed in order to use it for your recordings.
Alternatively you have the [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.Feedback
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to We ask that you send any feedback or additional question you have for us to daimangou@gmail.com
.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.LinkNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Link nodes allow for you to maintain a cleanlaytout by allowing you to connect your nodes withut drawing a visible line. This is particularly useful for reintroducing character in later scenes..

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.Main
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Thank you for BETA testing Storyteller for Unity. This interface will walk you through the basic use of the Storyteller.
Storyteller is a new way of telling stories. See into the past and present and future simultaneously while telling your story and visualize where, why , when and how every Dialogue in your story took place and who or what caused it to happen. .

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.MediaNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The media node allows you to play your story back to you . Note , the media node cannot be paused or stopped at the moment.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.RouteNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Route node allows your character to pick between multiple routs. This is especially useful for games where players must make decisions and have the story flow correctly regardless of which route is selected..

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.tutorialInfo
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Storyteller is an easy to use node editor a storytelling and storyboarding application which allows anyone writing stories or storyboarding ; to tell linier and non-linier stories, visually by giving you the ability to see the past present and future of a story simultaneously and make changes at will without breaking the flow of your story. This of course being a way of writing which is not possible in linier text based documents.
To begin using Storyteller,
- select a project type from the storyt [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Storyteller.Properties.TextResources.versionInfo
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to You sre now using Storyteler 2019
Here are a list of updates and change made to this version.
-Added Zoomable canvas. -Canvas rebuild. -Rebuild story editor window. -NEW html Exporter tool. -NEW Settings Window. -NEW: Abstract node. -NEW: BETA end node. -Full Template Editor. -Story Sample Editor in Late BETA. -Updated Context menu. -Updated Screenshot system. -Updated Shortcut Keys. -Added new Character biography system with history and evolution editor and tracking voice sample section [rest of string was truncated]";.
